sen.j: 近衛 基前（このえ もとさき、天明3年8月11日 (旧暦)（1783年9月7日） - 文政3年4月19日 (旧暦)（1820年5月30日））は江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Motosaki KONOE (September 7, 1783 - May 30, 1820) was kugyo (high court noble) in the late Edo period.
Motosaki KONOE (September 7, 1783 - May 30, 1820) was a Court noble who lived during the late Edo period.

sen.e: Motosaki KONOE (September 7, 1783 - May 30, 1820) was a Court noble who lived during the late Edo period.

sen.j: 養女に福君（鷹司政煕女子、徳川斉温室・定子）、増子（伏見宮貞敬親王第八女子、大谷光浄の妻）。
sen.e: He had adopted daughters including Sachigimi (Masahiro TAKATSUKASA's daughter as well as Teishi, Nariharu TOKUGAWA's wife) and Masuko (増子) (the 8th daughter of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayoshi).
sen.cmt: 徳川斉温の読み方は<http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%BE%B3%E5%B7%9D%E6%96%89%E6%B8%A9>を参照「福君」の読み方は<http://www.merumaga.pref.aichi.jp/mag/20070309/report.html>を参照「増子」読み方不明。
sen.e: His adopted daughters included Sachigimi (Masahiro TAKATSUKASA's daughter who became Nariharu TOKUGAWA's wife and was called Teishi) and Masuko (増子) (the 8th daughter of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayoshi who became Kojo OTANI's wife).
sen.cmt: as well asを用いると原文の意味が少し損なわれる感じが致します。また、「大谷光浄の妻」が訳漏れでしたので、読み方を推測して補いました。
sen.e: His adopted daughters included Sachigimi (Masahiro TAKATSUKASA's daughter who became Nariharu TOKUGAWA's wife and was called Teishi) and Masuko (増子) (the 8th daughter of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayoshi who became Kojo OTANI's wife).
